ul.li1: 1And I said,
“Listen, O heads of Jacob
ul.li2: and leaders of the house of Israel!
Is it not for you to know justice?
ul.li1: 2Those of you who are haters of good
ul.li2: and lovers of evil,
ul.li1: who tear their skin from them
ul.li2: and their flesh from their bones,
ul.li1: 3and who eat the flesh of my people,
ul.li2: and strip their skin from them,
ul.li1: and break their bones,
ul.li2: and chop them like meat in the pot,
and like flesh in the midst of a cooking pot.”
ul.li1: 4Then they will cry to Yahweh,
ul.li2: but he will not answer them.
ul.li1: He will hide his face from them at that time,
ul.li2: when they have made their deeds evil.
ul.li1: 5Thus says Yahweh concerning the prophets
ul.li2: who are leading my people astray,
ul.li1: who are biting with their teeth
ul.li2: and proclaim, “Peace,”
ul.li1: but whoever puts nothing into their mouths
ul.li2: they declare war against.
ul.li1: 6Therefore it will be as night to you, without vision,
ul.li2: and darkness to you, without divination.
ul.li1: And the sun will set on the prophets,
ul.li2: and the day will grow dark over them.
ul.li1: 7Then the seers will be disgraced,
ul.li2: and those practicing divination will be put to shame.
ul.li1: All of them will cover their lips,
ul.li2: for there is no reply from God.
ul.li1: 8But I, I am filled with power,
ul.li2: with the Spirit of Yahweh,
ul.li1: and with justice and might,
ul.li2: to declare to Jacob his rebellion,
and to Israel his sin.
ul.li1: 9Hear this, O rulers of the house of Jacob
ul.li2: and leaders of the house of Israel,
ul.li1: those detesting justice
ul.li2: and perverting all that is right,
ul.li1: 10he who builds Zion with blood
ul.li2: and Jerusalem with wickedness.
ul.li1: 11Its rulers judge for a bribe;
ul.li2: its priests teach for a price;
its prophets practice divination for money.
ul.li1: But they lean on Yahweh, saying,
ul.li2: “Is not Yahweh in our midst?
Disaster will not come upon us.”
ul.li1: 12Therefore on account of you
ul.li2: Zion will be plowed as a field,
ul.li1: and Jerusalem will be a heap of rubble,
ul.li2: and the temple mountLiterally “the mountain of the house” as a high place in a forest.
